job.title: Senior Counsel, Privacy & Data Protection
job.description:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team ‚Äì one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.¬†

Job Title

Senior Counsel, Privacy & Data Protection

Overview
‚Ä¢ Mastercard is committed to balancing innovation while protecting individual privacy and has embraced privacy and data protection as core to the successful execution of its business strategy. As part of that commitment Mastercard has established a world-class privacy programme and is currently adding talent to its global team.
‚Ä¢ The Senior Counsel will be responsible for ensuring that Mastercard‚Äôs Digital Payments solutions comply with privacy and data-related laws in the Europe region, including the EU General Data Protection Regulation (‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù).
‚Ä¢ The role will work directly with the business to implement Privacy by Design in products and processes while enabling business innovation.
‚Ä¢ The position will report to the Senior Managing Counsel ‚Äì Privacy & Data Protection and will be a member of the Global Privacy & Data Protection team as well as a member of the European Law, Franchise & Integrity (LFI) team.
‚Ä¢ The position is in either London or Waterloo.
‚Ä¢ The ideal candidate will have the ability to think and act both strategically and tactically with respect to the needs of business clients and their objectives while ensuring that the corporation remains compliant with privacy and data-related laws, as well as industry best practices.
‚Ä¢ The Senior Counsel must be familiar with digital payments ecosystem, including B2C and B2B services blockchain technology and cryptocurrency.
‚Ä¢
Role
‚Ä¢ Support the Network and Digital Payment Services, Blockchain and Digital Payments and Labs team in the Europe region to ensure compliance with privacy and data-related laws as well as Privacy by Design Guidelines.
‚Ä¢ Keep abreast of privacy and data protection issues arising from digital payments and blockchain..
‚Ä¢ Ensure appropriate documentation is in place in accordance with GDPR accountability requirements; conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments as needed.
‚Ä¢ Draft appropriate privacy terms in accordance with Mastercard‚Äôs standards, review contracts and manage complex negotiations with customers, partners and vendors.
‚Ä¢ Be involved in new privacy and data-related regulatory developments that may impact Mastercard's Digital Payments solutions. Assist engagement with key policy makers and stakeholders to influence regulatory developments in those areas.
‚Ä¢ Engage with the organisation on privacy and data-related matters, e.g. through employee training and raising employee awareness about relevant regulatory or industry developments.
‚Ä¢ Provide regular trainings and updates about emerging issues on blockchain and digital payments to the Global Privacy and Data Protection Team and creative approaches to ensure privacy compliance.
‚Ä¢ Actively participate in external speaking engagements on various privacy topics.

All About You
‚Ä¢ Law degree required. Membership to a Bar (if permitted by law).
‚Ä¢ Any additional qualifications (e.g. Master of Laws degree, CIPP/E) is considered an asset.
‚Ä¢ Solid knowledge of global privacy laws, including the GDPR, UK GDPR and relevant regulatory guidelines and opinions in the Europe Region.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated experience in working with business on product development with privacy by design in mind.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with and interest in financial services industry, payment processing, blockchain and digital payments.
‚Ä¢ Superior time management, planning, and organisational skills.
‚Ä¢ Strong analytic capabilities and written and oral communication skills. Attention to detail is a must.
‚Ä¢ Exceptional interpersonal skills with proven experience in relationship building and partnering. Must work well in both team and individual settings, including across global jurisdictions.
‚Ä¢ Ability to motivate and influence highly skilled professionals to achieve major organisational goals.

In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside Mastercard offices until further notice.

job.title: Sr. Product Manager - API / Core Platform Services
Solidity Engineer
job.description:
Do you want to build the foundations of a better web alongside a passionate, high-impact team? 3Box Labs is building the data rails for Web3, Ceramic Network. Already used by 1500 of the world's most ambitious applications, Ceramic is the building block for composable data.

You'll tackle some of the most novel challenges in decentralized tech, work closely with our rapidly growing open source community and many of the best technologists in the world, and help reinvent how data is managed online.

As our first Solidity engineer you will build out essential economic infrastructure for the Ceramic protocol.

You will..
  • Design, implement, and drive audit of Ceramics staking and bridge contracts that act as the root trust in the Ceramic protocol
  • Built a comprehensive test suite for our smart contract system, to simulate upgrades and various attack vectors
  • Collaborated with our platform team to build out monitoring for our smart contract system
  • Created comprehensive documentation for both users and developers of our contracts
  • Contributed to the design of the Ceramic blockchain (primarily how it interfaces with the smart contracts on Ethereum)
  • Work closely with Engineering, Research and Product areas to ship a consistent experience to our community
  • Collaborate with auditors to ensure code quality standards and security
  • Design and implement upgrades to the CeramicDAO, which is based on Gnosis Safe
  • Work with the team to design build out a curation market for Ceramic data models

    • You're likely a great candidate if you have...
  • 2+ years of experience in the web3 ecosystem
  • Deployed smart contracts that have seen real public usage (TLV, DAOs, NFTs, etc)
  • Understanding of the Ethereum Virtual Machine, gas optimization tradeoffs and security best practices.
  • Familiar with TDD frameworks for Solidity (e.g. hardhat, dapptools, truffle)
  • Familiar with L2s and how to deploy contracts to them (e.g. Arbitrum, Optimism, zkSync, zkEVM)
  • Familiar with important cryptographic primitives (e.g. bls, cryptographic hash functions, zero-knowledge proofs)
  • Understand the basics of finance and trading
  • Experience working in open source communities
    • The Team
    We are a lean, voraciously curious team from across the globe. We have 4 years of expert remote work experience and frequent (and awesome) team retreats to spend time together. We are impact-driven, intentional about our role, communications and actions, and intensely focused on building quality tools for our open source community. We believe a better model for managing identity and data online can give power back to users and builders, that this model is key to a growing movement, and that our team is a critical part of making that movement successful.

    We pay competitively and fairly across the globe, offer great and flexible benefits, and view everyone on our team as an owner -- both with generous equity grants and lots of agency to help set our direction.

    We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We cannot succeed in our mission without it. People that identify with groups traditionally underrepresented in tech are particularly encouraged to apply. 

    Learn more about 3Box Labs here.

job.title: Social Media Designer

You will work under the supervision of a Senior Designer to produce high-quality work that meets the necessary delivery and brand requirements of each client and platform.

Your goal will be to create impactful designs that represent start-ups and companies from across a wide variety of industries, to understand their unique brand identities and goals, and effectively engage potential investors through the graphics and layouts you make.

What you'll do:
